result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie M. Sledzik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
**P&P to begin assessment while deft is still confined.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be part time employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge  
May not have contact with in any with Michael or Roxanne McCarthy or their son or family, Ivanhoe's it's owners or employees, Carthage staff & UW Parkside, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim R.M. present.  Statement from Susan S.  On ct 2 the court imposes sentence of 8 months jail w/credit for 106 days served; costs ordered to be paid during period of probation on ct 3; pay $200 DNA surcharge; on ct 3 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years concurrent to ct 2; 12 months conditional jail is stayed; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; deft to enter mental health program if available while in jail; P&P to begin assessment while deft is still confined.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 4 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 2 & 3.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 3.  PSI ordered.  SEH 2/4/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/J. Thwing   Victims present.  DE requests more time to consider offer.  FPT adjourned to 12-17-14 at 8:45am.  Bond continues.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J German.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victims present.  ADA Phan states she just provided an offer.  FPT continued to 12/2/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. John German. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 11-13-14 @ 8:45am. Bond continued.
